name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _[SOUND] In this lecture
column6: we're going to talk about text access. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _In the previously lecture
column6: we talked about natural language content analysis. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: We explained that the state of the art natural language processing techniques

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: are still not good enough to process a lot of unrestricted text data

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: in a robust manner.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _As a result
column6: bag of words representation _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: remains very popular in applications like search engines.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: In this lecture we're going to talk about some high level strategies

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: to help users get access to the text data.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _This is also important step to convert raw
column6: big text data into small _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: relevant data that are actually needed in a specific application.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So the main question we address here is
column6: how can a text information system _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: help users get access to the relevant text data?

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _We're going to cover two complementary strategies
column6: push vs pull. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _And then we're going to talk about two ways to implement the pull mode

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: querying vs browsing.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So first
column6: push vs pull. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: These are two different ways to connect users with the right information

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: at the right time.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _The difference is which takes the initiative

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: which party it takes in the initiative.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _In the pull mode

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: the users would take the initiative to start the information access process.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _And in this case
column6: a user typically would use a search engine to fulfill the goal. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _For example
column6: the user may type in a query

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: then browse results to find the relevant information.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: So this is usually appropriate for

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: satisfying a user's ad hoc information need.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: An ad hoc information need is a temporary information need.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _For example
column6: you want to buy a product so _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: you suddenly have a need to read reviews about related products.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _But after you have collected information

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _you have purchased your product
column6: you generally no longer need such information. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: So it's a temporary information need.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _In such a case
column6: it's very hard for a system to predict your need

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: it's more appropriate for the users to take the initiative.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _And that's why search engines are very useful today

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: because many people have many ad hoc information needs all the time.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So as we are speaking Google probably is processing many queries from this
column6: and _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _those are all
column6: or mostly ad hoc information needs. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: So this is a pull mode.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _In contrast
column6: in the push mode the system will take the initiative _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: to push the information to the user or to recommend the information to the user.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So in this case
column6: this is usually supported by a recommender system. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: Now this would be appropriate if the user has a stable information need.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _For example
column6: you may have a research interest in some topic

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _that interest tends to stay for a while
column6: so it's relatively stable. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: Your hobby is another example of a stable information need.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _In such a case
column6: the system can interact with you and can learn your interest

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: then can monitor the information stream.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _If it is
column6: the system hasn't seen any relevant items to your interest

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: the system could then take the initiative to recommend information to you.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So for example
column6: a news filter or _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: news recommender system could monitor the news stream and

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _identify interest in news to you
column6: and simply push the news articles to you. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: This mode of information access may be also appropriate when

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: the system has a good knowledge about the user's need.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: And this happens in the search context.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So for example
column6: when you search for information on the web a search _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: engine might infer you might be also interested in some related information.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: And they would recommend the information to you.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So that should remind you for example
column6: advertisement placed on a search page. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So this is about the
column6: the two high level strategies or two modes of text access. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: Now let's look at the pull mode in more detail.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _In the pull mode
column6: we can further this in usually two ways to help users

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: querying vs browsing.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _In querying
column6: a user would just enter a query

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: the search engine system would return relevant documents to users.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _And this works well when the user knows what exactly key

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: are the keywords to be used.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: So if you know exactly what you're looking for

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _you tend to know the right keywords
column6: and then query would work very well. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: And we do that all the time.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: But we also know that sometimes it doesn't work so

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _well
column6: when you don't know the right keywords to use in the query or _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: you want to browse information in some topic area.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: In this case browsing would be more useful.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: So in this case in the case of browsing the users would simply navigate

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: into the relevant information by following the path that's

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: supported by the structures on the documents.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So the system would maintain some kind of structures
column6: and _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: then the user could follow these structures to navigate.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: So this strategy works well when the user wants to explore information space or

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: the user doesn't know what are the keywords to use in the query.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _Or simply because the user
column6: finds it inconvenient to type in the query. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So even if a user knows what query to type in
column6: if the user is using a cell phone _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _to search for information
column6: then it's still hard to enter the query. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _In such a case again
column6: browsing tends to be more convenient. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: The relationship between browsing and

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: the query is best understood by making an analogy to sightseeing.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: Imagine if you are touring a city.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _Now if you know the exact address of a attraction
column6: then taking a taxi _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _there is perhaps the fastest way
column6: you can go directly to the site. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _But if you don't know the exact address
column6: you may need to walk around

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _you can take a taxi to a nearby place
column6: and then walk around. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: It turns out that we do exactly the same in the information space.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _If you know exactly what you are looking for
column6: then you can _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: use the right keywords in your query to find the information directly.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: That's usually the fastest way to do find information.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: But what if you don't know the exact keywords to use?

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _Well
column6: your query probably won't work so well
column7: and you will land on some related _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _pages
column6: and then you need to also walk around in the information space. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _Meaning by following the links or by browsing

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: you can then finally get into the relevant page.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _If you want to learn about a topic again
column6: you you will likely do a lot of browsing. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: So just like you are looking around in some area and

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: you want to see some interesting attractions in a related

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: in the same region.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: So this analogy also tells us that today we have very good support for

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _querying
column6: but we don't really have good support for browsing. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _And this is because in order to browse effectively
column6: we need a a map to guide us

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: just like you need a map of Chicago to tour the city of Chicago.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: You need a topical map to tour the information space.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: So how to construct such a topical map is in fact a very interesting

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: research question that likely will bring us

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: more interesting browsing experience on the web or in other applications.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _So to summarize this lecture
column6: we have talked about two high level strategies for _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _text access
column6: push and pull. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: Push tends to be supported by a recommender system and

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: pull tends to be supported by a search engine.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _Of course in the sophisticated intent in the information system

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: we should combine the two.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: In the pull mode we have further distinguished querying and browsing.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _Again
column6: we generally want to combine the two ways to help users so _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: that you can support both querying and browsing.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: If you want to know more about the relationship between pull and

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _push
column6: you can read this article. _

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: This gives a excellent discussion of the relationship between information filtering

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: and information retrieval.

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: _Here information filtering is similar to information recommendation

name: 2 - 2 - 1.2 Text Access (00-09-24).srt
text: or the push mode of information access.
